strapiPost.title: Weekend Roundup
strapiPost.content:
This is one of the last weekends of summer for the kids, and it's full of things to do.

  • Ready to rumble: Rodeo of the Ozarks' Demolition Derby is racing into Springdale on Saturday.
  • On the rocks: The Bentonville Whiskey Festival is back, and it's got food, entertainment, and whiskey to share with adults from across the region.
  • Sounds of Sunday: The Momentary's Courtyard Sessions are back this weekend, with live music from One Penny Shy and The Irie Lions, presented by House of Songs.
  • Moving fast: Mountain bikers from across the region can compete in the Kessler Mountain Jam.
  • Behind the brains: Factory Obscura is an art collective that's bringing its talents to downtown Springdale this fall, and the exhibition opens tonight.
  • To the ball game: The NWA Naturals are facing off against the Frisco RoughRiders this weekend.
  • Food, music, art: Crystal Bridges is hosting a Food Truck Rodeo this Sunday.
  • Dinner and a movie: The Hwy 112 Drive-In movie theater will have family-friendly movie choices every night this weekend.

Have a great weekend, and see you Monday!
